title: Westward Expansion and the Oregon Trail

vocab.definition: The movement of Americans from the eastern states to western territories
A 2,000-mile route used by pioneers traveling west to Oregon
A person who travels to unsettled areas to live
The belief that Americans had the right to expand across the continent
A wagon with a canvas top used by pioneers traveling west

teachingNotes: Discuss the challenges of pioneer life and the impact on Native Americans. Emphasize the determination and hardships of westward travelers.

sample.question: What was the main route pioneers used to travel to Oregon?

truefalse.question: The Oregon Trail was about 2,000 miles long.

multiplechoice.question: What belief encouraged Americans to expand westward?

fillintheblank.question: Pioneers traveled west in ________ wagons covered with canvas.

shortanswer.question: What were three challenges pioneers faced on the Oregon Trail?
